item.title: Is Juncker capable of being a reformist Commission President, like Nixon was in going to China?
item.description:
Steve Peers A common saying in American politics, “only Nixon could go to China,” suggests that only a politician with a well-established reputation can persuade their base to accept a major policy shift. Nixon, a staunch anti-Communist, was able to convince American conservatives that engaging with Communist China was in their best interest. This principle might apply to the European Union as well. The recent European Parliament (EP) elections saw a rise in support for anti-EU parties in several Member States...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/is-juncker-capable-of-being-a-reformist-commission-president-like-nixon-was-in-going-to-china/

item.title: The CJEU's responses to the Iraq war and EU asylum law are uncertain.
item.description:
Steve Peers Almost twelve years after it began, the Iraq war remains a point of contention, with many believing Tony Blair and George W. Bush initiated an unlawful conflict. These critics believe only a trial for war crimes for both Bush and Blair would be a satisfactory outcome. While I believe this may happen someday, it would require a jury of highly improbable individuals. (Perhaps those individuals disappeared alongside the supposed weapons of mass destruction)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-cjeu-s-responses-to-the-iraq-war-and-eu-asylum-law-are-uncertain/
